revised_title: Embryological Development and Metamorphosis of Leucosolenia variabilis
tldr: The author studies the larval development and metamorphosis of Leucosolenia variabilis, a type of sponge. The larvae undergo a series of changes, including the transformation of ciliated cells into granular cells, and the formation of a lens-like body that may be a primitive light-perceiving organ. The metamorphosis is completed in a few hours after the larvae fix themselves to the bottom of the water.
